name: Introduction to Religious Studies
description: This course provides an introduction to the study of religion from a comparative and interdisciplinary perspective.

name: Foundations of Comparative Religion
description: This course explores the foundations of comparative religion, introducing students to the major religious traditions and exploring the ways in which they have interacted with one another.

name: History of Comparative Religion
description: This course examines the historical development of comparative religion from its ancient roots to the present day.

name: Philosophy of Comparative Religion
description: This course examines the philosophical implications of comparative religion, exploring the major questions and debates surrounding the topic.

name: Advanced Comparative Religion
description: This course is an advanced exploration of the various aspects of comparative religion, from its origins to its contemporary applications.
